description: Reading and discussion of almost all of Shakespeare's history plays and romantic comedies: the first and second tetrologies (HENRY VI PARTS 1, 2, and 3, and RICHARD III), (RICHARD II, HENRY IV, PARTS 1 AND 2, HENRY V), as well as THE COMEDY OF ERRORS, THE TAMING OF THE SHREW, LOVE'S LABOR'S LOST, A MIDSUMMER NIGHT'S DREAM, THE MERCHANT OF VENICE, MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING, AS YOU LIKE IT, and TWELFTH NIGHT. These plays, in effect, give a thorough picture of Shakespeare's development as a playwright during the first half of his career.
name: SHAKES: HIST & COMEDIES
